tasksList.name: Infering Information
tasksList.context: In a recent survey conducted by the government, public sector employees were asked to rate their level of satisfaction with the department they work at. The results revealed that NASA was the most popular department with a satisfaction rating of 95%. One NASA employee, John Smith, commented on the findings, stating, I'm not surprised that NASA came out on top. It's a great place to work with amazing people and incredible opportunities. I'm proud to be a part of such an innovative organization.The results were also welcomed by NASA's management team, with Director Tom Johnson stating, We are thrilled to hear that our employees are satisfied with their work at NASA. We have a talented and dedicated team who work tirelessly to achieve our goals, and it's fantastic to see that their hard work is paying off. The survey also revealed that the Social Security Administration had the lowest satisfaction rating, with only 45% of employees indicating they were satisfied with their job. The government has pledged to address the concerns raised by employees in the survey and work towards improving job satisfaction across all departments.
tasksList.input:
Determine whether each item in the following {topic_list} is a topic in the text. 
Give your answer as list with 0 or 1 for each topic. Text:
tasksList.valvalue: nasa, local government, engineering, employee satisfaction, federal government

tasksList.name: Cover Letter
tasksList.context:
Paste your CV. 

Paste the information about the job posting.
tasksList.input:
Could you please generate a cover letter with the information provided in the JSON {cover_letter}. This Cover Letter should include relevant information about my experience, training, and the skills that make me a good fit for the position with a strict word limit of 400 words to apply for ["position"] position at ["company"], using the job responsibilities as a reference. Also, use my attached resume, including my experience, qualifications, and education in AI and Computer Science, to match the job. 
Please sign the letter as ["myname"], all the information you will find in:

tasksList.name: Translate Formats
tasksList.input: Translate the following JSON to an HTML table with column headers and title: {data_json}

tasksList.name: Response Reviews
tasksList.context:
Review_1: "Exceptional service! My clothes came back cleaner than ever, and they even managed to remove a stubborn stain. I'm impressed with the attention to detail." 

Review_2: "The overall experience was decent. The quality was acceptable, but nothing particularly stood out. It's a standard laundry service, nothing more, nothing less." 

Review_3: " The price is extremely expensive for the service provided. I've used other services that offer similar quality at a lower cost. It's not the most budget-friendly option." 

Review_4: "Quick turnaround time and very convenient. I dropped off my laundry in the morning and it was ready by the afternoon. Definitely a time-saver!" 

Review_5: "Unfortunately, my favorite shirt came back with a small tear near the sleeve. I'm furious, they should be careful with delicate fabrics."
tasksList.input:
Your task is to write a response for each review, define each subject. 
Generate a reply to thank the customer for their review. 
If the sentiment is positive or neutral, thank them for their review. 
If the sentiment is negative, apologize and suggest that they can reach out to customer service. 
Make sure to use specific details from the review, and write a concise text. 
Sign the each email as {signature}. 
Customer reviews:

tasksList.name: Reviews Classification
tasksList.context:
Review_1: "Exceptional service! My clothes came back cleaner than ever, and they even managed to remove a stubborn stain. I'm impressed with the attention to detail." 

Review_2: "The overall experience was decent. The quality was acceptable, but nothing particularly stood out. It's a standard laundry service, nothing more, nothing less." 

Review_3: " The price is extremely expensive for the service provided. I've used other services that offer similar quality at a lower cost. It's not the most budget-friendly option." 

Review_4: "Quick turnaround time and very convenient. I dropped off my laundry in the morning and it was ready by the afternoon. Definitely a time-saver!" 

Review_5: "Unfortunately, my favorite shirt came back with a small tear near the sleeve. I'm furious, they should be careful with delicate fabrics."
tasksList.input:
Your task is to identify the following items for each review texts 
- Expressed sentiment (neutral, positive, 
- Is the reviewer expressing anger? (true or false) 
- which garment or garments were washed in each case. 
Reviews:
